snippet: Ansar al-Shariah, the brigade of rebel fighters that witnesses say led the attack on the United States diplomatic mission in Benghazi, holds that democracy is incompatible with Islam.
abstract: Ansar al-Sharia, Libyan brigade of rebel fighters that witnesses say led the attack on the United States diplomatic mission in Benghazi, is just one of many autonomous battalions of heavily armed men formed during and after the uprising against Col Muammar el-Qaddafi; Benghazi attack underscores how major cities are still controlled by a patchwork of independent militias who all keep their weapons at the ready.

byline.original: By DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK, SULIMAN ALI ZWAY and KAREEM FAHIM

lead_paragraph: Ansar al-Shariah, the brigade of rebel fighters that witnesses say led the attack on the United States diplomatic mission in Benghazi, holds that democracy is incompatible with Islam.

headline.seo: Attack by Fringe Group Highlights the Problem of Libya Militias
headline.main: Attack by Fringe Group Highlights the Problem of Libya’s Militias
headline.print_headline: Attack by Fringe Group Highlights the Problem of Libya’s Militias
